title: General and beneficent rules

duas.meaning: When night falls, restrain your children (from going out) because at such time the devils spread about. After a period of time has passed, let them be. Shut your doors and mention Allah’s name, for verily the devil does not open a shut door, tie up your waterskins and mention Allah’s name, cover your vessels with anything and mention Allah’s name and put out your lamps.

title: How the Prophet (saws) made tasbeeh

duas.meaning: AAabdullah Ibn AAamr said : I saw the Prophet (saws)make tasbeeh with his right hand.]

title: Excellence of remembrance and glorification of Allah

duas.meaning: How perfect Allah is and I praise Him.[one hundred times daily
duas.transliteration: Subhana llahi wa bihamdihi. (100 x)

duas.meaning: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner. To Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent. [ten times
duas.transliteration: La ilaha illa llahu, wahdahu la sharika lahu, lahulmulku wa lahulhamdu, wa huwa  ala kulli shay'in qadir. (10 x)

duas.meaning: Aboo Hurayrah reported that the Messenger of Allah (saws) said : (There are) two words, (which are) light on the tongue, heavy on the scale and beloved to The Most Gracious :]How perfect Allah is and I praise Him. How perfect Allah is, The Supreme.
duas.transliteration: Subhana llahi wa bihamdihi. Subhana llahil azim.

duas.meaning: Aboo Hurayrah reported that the Messenger of Allah (saws)said :  Saying ... :] How perfect Allah is, and all praise is for Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, and Allah is the greatest. [...is more beloved to me than everything the sun has risen over.]
duas.transliteration: Subhana llahi, walhamdu lillahi, wa la ilaha illa llahu, wa llahu akbar.

duas.meaning: How perfect Allah is and I praise Him. [one hundred times
duas.transliteration: Subhana llahi. (100 x)

duas.meaning: Jabbir related that the Prophet (saws) said : Whoever says :] How perfect Allah is, The Supreme, and I praise Him. [...a palm tree is planted for him in paradise.]
duas.transliteration: Subhana llahil azimi wa bihamdihi.

duas.meaning: There is no might nor power except with Allah.
duas.transliteration: La hawla wa la quwwata illa billahi.

duas.meaning: How perfect Allah is, and all praise is for Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, and Allah is the greatest.
duas.transliteration: Subhana llahi, walhamdu lillahi, wa la ilaha illa llahu, wa llahu akbar.

duas.meaning:
None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone without partener. Allah is most great and much praise is for Allah. How perfect Allah is, Lord of the worlds. There is no might nor power except with Allah, The Exalted in might, The Wise.
O Allah, forgive me, have mercy upon me, guide me and grant me sustenance.
duas.transliteration:
La ilaha illa llahu, wahdahu la sharika lahu. Allahu akbaru kabiran, walhamdu lillahi kathiran. Subhana llahi rabbil alamina. La hawla wa la quwwata illa billahil azizilhakim.
Allahumma ghfir li, wa rhamni, wa hdini, wa rzuqni.

duas.meaning: O Allah, forgive me, have mercy upon me, guide me, give me health and grant me sustenance.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma ghfir li, wa rhamni, wa hdini, wa  afini, wa rzuqni.

duas.meaning: All praise is for Allah.None has the right to be worshipped except Allah.
duas.transliteration: Al hamdu lillah.La ilaha illa llah.

duas.meaning: How perfect Allah is, and all praise is for Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, and Allah is the greatest. There is no might nor power except with Allah.
duas.transliteration: Subhana llahi, walhamdu lillahi, wa la ilaha illa llahu, wa llahu akbaru, wa la hawla wa la quwwata illa billahi.

title: Seeking forgiveness and repentance

duas.meaning: The Messenger of Allah (saws) said : 'By Allah, I seek forgiveness and repent to Allah, more than seventy times a day.'
The Messenger of Allah (saws) said : ‘O People, Repent! Verily I repent to Allah, a hundred times a day.'
I seek Allah’s forgiveness, besides whom, none has the right to be worshipped except He, The Ever Living, The SelfSubsisting and Supporter of all, and I turn to Him in repentance.
duas.transliteration: Astaghfiru llahal azima lladhi la ilaha illa huwalhayyulqayyÃ»mu, wa atÃ»bu ilayhi.

duas.meaning: The Messenger of Allah (saws) said : ‘The nearest the Lord comes to His servant is in the middle of the night, so if you are able to be of those who remember Allah at that time, then be so.'
The Messenger of Allah (saws) said : ‘The nearest a servant is to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so supplicate much therein.'
The Messenger of Allah (saws) said : ‘Verily my heart becomes preoccupied, and verily I seek Allah’s forgiveness a hundred times a day.'

title: To ward off the deception of the Obstinate Shaytans

duas.meaning: I take refuge within Allah’s perfect words which no righteous or unrighteous person can transgress, from all the evil that He has created, made and originated. (I take refuge) from the evil that descends from the sky and the evil that rises up to it. (I take refuge) from the evil that is spread on Earth and the evil that springs from her, and I take refuge from the evil of the tribulations of night and day, and the evil of one who visits at night except the one who brings good, O Merciful One.
duas.transliteration: A Ã»dhu bikalimati llahi ttammati llati la yujawaizuhunna barrun wa la farijun min sharri ma khalaqa wa bara'a wa dhara'a, wa min sharri ma ya rujuhu fiha, wa min sharri ma dhara'a filardi wa min sharri ma yakhruju minha, wa min sharri fitani llayli wa nnahari, wa min sharri kulli tariqin illa tariqan yatruqu bikhayrin ya rahman.

title: When slaughtering or offering a sacrifice

duas.meaning: In the name of Allah, and Allah is the greatest. O Allah, (it is) from You and belongs to You, O Allah, accept this from me.
duas.transliteration: Bismi llahi wa llahu akbar. [Allahumma minka wa laka]. Allahumma taqabbal minni.

title: When startled

duas.meaning: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah.
duas.transliteration: La ilaha illa llahu.

title: When in fear of afflicting something or someone with one’s eye

duas.meaning: If you see something from your brother, yourself or wealth which you find impressing, then invoke blessings for it, for the evil eye is indeed true.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma barik  alayhi.

title: When feeling some pain in the body

duas.meaning:
In the name of Allah. (three times)
I take refuge in Allah and within His omnipotence from the evil that I feel and am wary of. (seven times)
duas.transliteration: Bismi llahi (3 x), puis : A Ã»dhu billahi wa qudratihi min sharri ma ajidu wa uhadhiru (7 x).

title: Upon receiving pleasant news

duas.meaning: The Prophet (saws) would prostrate in gratitude to Allah upon receiving news which pleased him or which caused pleasure.

title: At times of amazement and delight

duas.meaning: How perfect Allah is.
duas.transliteration: Subhana llah.

duas.meaning: Allah is the greatest.
duas.transliteration: Allahu akbar.

title: When throwing each pebble at the Jamarat

duas.meaning: Every time the Prophet (saws) threw a pebble at any of the three jamarat, he would say :] Allah is the greatest. […on completion of the first jamarah, he advanced a little, stood facing the qiblah, raised his hands and supplicated. He also did this after the second jamarah but not the third.
duas.transliteration: Allahu akbar.

title: Remembrance at Muzdalifa

duas.meaning: Jabir t said : 'He (saws) rode AlQaswa until he reached AlMashAAar AlHaram, he then faced the qiblah, supplicated to Allah, and extoled His greatness and oneness. He stood until the sun shone but left before it rose.'}

title: The Day of 'Arafah

duas.meaning: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner. To Him belongs all praise and sovereignty and He is over all things omnipotent.
duas.transliteration: La ilaha illa llahu wahdahu la sharika lahu, lahulmulku wa lahu lhamdu, wa huwa  ala kulli shay’in qadir.

title: When at Mount Safa and Mount Marwah

duas.meaning:
Indeed Safa and Marwah are from the places of worship of Allah…
None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, Allah is the greatest.
None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner.To Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things amnipotent. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah alone. He fulfilled His promise, aided His Servant and singlehandedly defeated the allies.
duas.transliteration:
Vers Safa : Inna ssafa walmarwata min sha a'iri llah. Abda'u bima badaa llahu bihi.
Vers la Ka ba : La ilaha illa llahu, Allahu akbar, La ilaha illa llahu, wahdahu la sharika lahu, lahulmulku wa lahulhamdu, wa huwa ala kulli shay'in qadirun. La ilaha illa llahu wahdahu. Anjaza wa dahu, wa nasara abdahu, wa hamazalahzaba wahdahu.

title: Between the Yemeni corner and the black stone

duas.meaning: O our Lord, grant us the best in this life and the best in the next life, and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.
duas.transliteration: Rabbana atina fi ddunya hasanatan wa filakhirati hasanatan wa qina  adhaba nnar.

title: The Takbir passing the black stone

duas.meaning: Allah is the greatest.
duas.transliteration: Allahu akbar.

title: The Talbiya for the one doing Haj or 'Omra

duas.meaning: Here I am O Allah, (in response to Your call), here I am. Here I am, You have no partner, here I am. Verily all praise, grace and sovereignty belong to You. You have no partner.
duas.transliteration: Labbayka llahumma labbayka. La sharika laka labbayka. Innalhamda wa nni mata laka walmulku. La sharika laka.

title: For the one that have been praised

duas.meaning: O Allah, don't punish me for what they say, forgive me for what they don't know, (and make me better than what they think of me)
duas.transliteration: Allahumma la tu'akhidhni bima yaqÃ»lÃ»na, wa ghfir li ma la ya lamun, [wa j alni khayran mimma yazunnÃ»n].

title: The etiquette of praising a fellow Muslim

duas.meaning: I deem soandso to be…and Allah is his reckoner…and I don’t praise anyone, putting it (i.e. my praising) forward, in front of Allah’s commendation, however I assume him so and so’…if he knows that of him.

title: For one you have insulted

duas.meaning: O Allah, to any believer whom I have insulted, let that be cause to draw him near to You on the Day of Resurrection.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma faayyuma mu'minin sababtuhu, faj al dhalika lahu qurbatan ilayka yawmalqiyamati.

title: Upon hearing the barking of dogs at night

duas.meaning: If you hear the barking of dogs or the braying of asses at night, seek refuge in Allah for they see what you do not.
duas.transliteration: A Ã»dhu billahi mina shshaytani rrajim.

title: Upon hearing a rooster crow or the braying of an ass

duas.meaning: If you hear the crow of a rooster, ask Allah for his bounty for it has seen an angel and if you hear the braying of an ass, seek refuge in Allah for it has seen a devil.
duas.transliteration: A Ã»dhu billahi mina shshaytani rrajim.

title: Returning a greeting to a misbeliever

duas.meaning: And upon you.
duas.transliteration: Wa  alaykum.

title: Excellence of spreading the Islamic greeting

duas.meaning: The Messenger of Allah (saws) said : You shall not enter paradise until you believe, and you shall not believe until you love one another. Shall I not inform you of something, if you were to act upon it, you will indeed achieve mutual love for one another? Spread the greeting amongst yourselves.
duas.transliteration: Assalamu  alaykum.

duas.meaning: AAammar t said : Three characteristics, whoever combines them, has completed his faith: to be just, to spread greetings to all people and to spend (charitably) out of the little you have.

AAabdullah Ibn AAamr t reported that a man asked the Prophet (saws) : ‘Which Islam is the best?’. He (saws) replied : 'Feed (the poor), and greet those whom you know as well as those whom you do not.’

title: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (saws)

duas.meaning: The Prophet (saws) said : Whoever sends a prayer upon me, Allah sends ten upon him.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma salli  ala Muhammadin wa  ala ali Muhammadin kama sallayta  ala Ibrahima wa  ala ali Ibrahima. Innaka hamidun, majid. Allahumma barik  ala Muhammadin wa  ala ali Muhammadin kama barakta  ala Ibrahima wa  ala ali Ibrahima. Innaka hamidun, majid.

duas.meaning: The Prophet (saws) said : Do not take my grave as a place of habitual ceremony. Send prayers upon me, for verily your prayers reach me wherever you are.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma salli  ala Muhammadin wa  ala ali Muhammadin kama sallayta  ala Ibrahima wa  ala ali Ibrahima. Innaka hamidun, majid. Allahumma barik  ala Muhammadin wa  ala ali Muhammadin kama barakta  ala Ibrahima wa  ala ali Ibrahima. Innaka hamidun, majid.

duas.meaning: The Prophet (saws) said : A miser is one whom when I am mentioned to him, fails to send prayers upon me.
duas.transliteration: Salla llahu  alayhi wa sallam.

duas.meaning: The Prophet (saws) : "Allah exalted He is has got angels scouring the earth to spread the salutations of my community."
The Prophet (saws) said : Every time somebody greets me, Allah gives me back my soul for me to answer this greeting."

title: What to say upon receiving pleasing or displeasing news

duas.meaning:
All Praise is for Allah by whose favour good works are accomplished.
All Praise is for Allah in all circumstances.
duas.transliteration:
Al hamdu lillahi lladhi bini matihi tatimmu ssalihatu.
Al hamdu lillahi ala kulli halin.

title: While returning from travel

duas.meaning:
Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest.
None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner. To Him belongs all sovereignty and praise, and He is over all things omnipotent. We return, repent, worship and praise our Lord. Allah fulfilled His promise, aided His Servant, and singlehandedly defeated the allies.
duas.transliteration:
Chaque x que l'on atteint un point Ã©levÃ© : Allahu akbar (trois x).
Dire ensuite : La ilaha illa llahu, wahdahu la sharika lahu, lahulmulku wa lahulhamdu, wa huwa ala kulli shay'in qadirun. ayibÃ»na, ta'ibÃ»na, abidÃ»na, lirabbina hamidÃ»n.
Sadaqa llahu wa dahu, wa nasara abdahu wa hazamalahzaba wahdahu.

title: Stopping or lodging somewhere

duas.meaning: I take refuge in Allah’s perfect words from the evil that He has created.
duas.transliteration: A Ã»dhu bikalimati llahi ttammati min sharri ma khalaq.

title: Prayer of the traveller as dawn approaches

duas.meaning: May a witness, be witness to our praise of Allah for His favours and bounties upon us. Our Lord, protect us, show favour on us and deliver us from every evil. I take refuge in Allah from the fire.
duas.transliteration: Samma a sami un bihamdi llahi, wa husni bala'ihi  alayna. Rabbana sahibna wa afdil  alayna  a'idhan billahi mina nnar.

duas.meaning: While ascending :] Allah is the greatest.[and when descending :] How perfect Allah is.
duas.transliteration: Lors d'une montÃ©e : Allahu akbar.Lors d'une descente : Subhanallah.

title: Supplication of the resident for the traveller

duas.meaning: I place your religion, your faithfulness and the ends of your deeds in the trust of Allah.
duas.transliteration: Astawdi u llaha dinaka wa amanataka wa khawatima  amalika.

duas.meaning: May Allah endow you with taqwa, forgive your sins and facilitate all good for you, wherever you be.
duas.transliteration: Zawwadaka llahu ttaqwa, wa ghafara dhanbaka, wa yassara lakalkhayra haythu ma kunta.

title: Supplication of the traveller for the resident

duas.meaning: I place you in the trust of Allah, whose trust is never misplaced.
duas.transliteration: Astawdi ukumu llaha lladhi la tadi u wada'i uhu.

title: When the mounted animal (or mean of transport) stumbles

duas.meaning: In the name of Allah.
duas.transliteration: Bismillah.

title: When entering the market

duas.meaning: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise. He gives life and causes death, and He is living and does not die. In His hand is all good and He is over all things, omnipotent.
duas.transliteration: La ilaha illa llahu, wahdahu la sharika lahu, lahulmulku wa lahulhamdu, yuhyi wa yumitu, wa huwa hayyun la yamÃ»tu, biyadihilkhayru, wa huwa  ala kulli shay'in qadir.

title: Upon entering a town or village

duas.meaning: O Allah, Lord of the seven heavens and all that they envelop, Lord of the seven earths and all that they carry, Lord of the devils and all whom they misguide, Lord of the winds and all whom they whisk away. I ask You for the goodness of this village, the goodness of its inhabitants and for all the goodness found within it and I take refuge with You from the evil of this village, the evil of its inhabitants and from all the evil found within it.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma rabba ssamawati ssab i wa ma zzlalna, wa rabbalaradina ssab i wa ma aqlalna, wa rabba shshayatini wa ma adlalna, wa rabba rriyahi wa ma dharayna. As'alukakhayra hadhihilqaryati wa khayra ahliha wa khayra ma fiha, wa a Ã»dhu bika min sharriha wa sharri ahliha wa sharri ma fiha.

title: For travel

duas.meaning: Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest, How perfect He is, The One Who has placed this (transport) at our service, and we ourselves would not have been capable of that, and to our Lord is our final destiny. O Allah, we ask You for birr and taqwa in this journey of ours, and we ask You for deeds which please You. O Allah, facilitate our journey and let us cover it’s distance quickly. O Allah, You are The Companion on the journey and The Successor over the family, O Allah, I take refuge with You from the difficulties of travel, from having a change of hearts and being in a bad predicament, and I take refuge in You from an ill fated outcome with wealth and family. [upon returning the same supplication is recited with the following addition :] (We return, repent, worship and praise our Lord.)
duas.transliteration: Allahu akbaru, Allahu akbaru, Allahu akbaru. Subhana lladhi sakhkhara lana hadha wa ma kunna lahu muqrinin, wa inna ila rabbina lamunqalibÃ»n. Allahumma inna nasaluka fi safarina hadha albirra wa ttaqwa wa minal amali ma tarda. Allahumma hawwin  alayna safarana hadha wa twi  anna bu dahu. Allahumma anta ssahibu fi ssafari, walkhalifatu filahli. Allahumma inni a Ã»dhu bika min wa tha'i ssafari wa ka'abatilmanzari, wa sÃ»'ilmunqalabi filmali walahli.Au retour, rÃ©pÃ©ter l'invocation et ajouter : ayibÃ»n, ta'ibÃ»n,  abidÃ»n, lirabbina hamidÃ»n.

title: When mounting an animal or any means of transport

duas.meaning: In the name of Allah and all praise is for Allah. How perfect He is, the One Who has placed this (transport) at our service and we ourselves would not have been capable of that, and to our Lord is our final destiny. All praise is for Allah, All praise is for Allah, All praise is for Allah, Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest. How perfect You are, O Allah, verily I have wronged my soul, so forgive me, for surely none can forgive sins except You.
duas.transliteration: Bismi llahi. Al hamdu lillahi. Subhana lladhi sakhkhara lana hadha wa ma kunna lahu muqrinin, wa inna ila rabbina lamunqalibÃ»n. Al hamdu lillahi, al hamdu lillahi, al hamdu lillahi. Allahu akbaru, Allahu akbaru, Allahu akbaru. Subhanaka llahumma inni zalamtu nafsi, faghfir li, fainnahu la yaghfiru dhdhunÃ»ba illa ant.

title: Forbiddance of ascribing things to omens

duas.meaning: O Allah, there is no omen but there is reliance on You, there is no good except Your good and none has the right to be worshipped except You.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma, la tayra illa tayruka, wa la khayra illa khayruka, wa la ilaha ghayruka.

title: Returning a supplication after having bestowed a gift or charity upon someone

duas.meaning: May Allah bless you all.
duas.transliteration: Wa fika barakallah

title: For fear of shirk

duas.meaning: O Allah, I take refuge in You lest I should commit shirk with You knowingly and I seek Your forgiveness for what I do unknowingly.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a Ã»dhu bika an ushrika bika wa ana a lamu, wa astaghfiruka lima la a lam.

title: To the debtor when his debt is settled

duas.meaning: May Allah bless for you, your family and wealth. Surely commendation and payment are the reward for a loan.
duas.transliteration: Baraka llahu laka fi ahlika wa malika. Innama jaza'u ssalafilhamdu walada'.

title: To one who has offered you some of his wealth

duas.meaning: May Allah bless for you, your family and wealth.
duas.transliteration: Baraka llahu laka fi ahlika wa malika.

title: To one who pronounces his love for you, for Allah’s sake

duas.meaning: May He, for whom you have loved me, love you.
duas.transliteration: Ahabbaka lladhi ahbabtani lahu.

title: Protection from the Dajjal

duas.meaning: Whoever memorises the first ten verses of soorat AlKahf will be protected from Dajjal. One should also seek refuge with Allah from the tribulations of the Dajjal after the last tashahhud in prayer.
duas.transliteration: Voir invocations n°55 et 56

title: To one who does you a favour

duas.meaning: May Allah reward you with goodness.
duas.transliteration: Jazaka llahu khayran.

title: Returning a supplication of forgiveness

duas.meaning: ... and you!
duas.transliteration: Wa laka.

title: For the expiation of sins, said at the conclusion of a sitting or gathering

duas.meaning: How perfect You are O Allah, and I praise You. I bear witness that None has the right to be worshipped except You. I seek Your forgiveness and turn to You in repentance.
duas.transliteration: Subhanaka llahumma wa bihamdika. Ashhadu an la ilaha illa anta, astaghfiruka wa atÃ»bu ilayka.

title: At a sitting or gathering

duas.meaning: O my Lord, forgive me and turn towards me (to accept my repentance). Verily You are The OftReturning. The OftForgiving.
duas.transliteration: Rabbi ghfir li wa tub  alayya. Innaka anta ttawwabulghafÃ»r.

title: Upon seeing someone in trial or tribulation

duas.meaning: All praise is for Allah Who saved me from that which He tested you with and Who most certainly favoured me over much of His creation.
duas.transliteration: Al hamdu lillahi lladhi  afani mimma btalaka bihi wa faddalani  ala kathirin mimman khalaqa tafdilan.

title: When angry

duas.meaning: I take refuge with Allah from the accursed devil.
duas.transliteration: A Ã»dhu billahi mina shshaytani rrajim.

title: Before sexual intercourse

duas.meaning: In the name of Allah. O Allah, keep the devil away from us and keep the devil away from what you have blessed us with.
duas.transliteration: Bismi llahi. Allahumma jannibna shshaytana, wa jannibi shshaytana ma razaqtana.

title: On the wedding night or when buying an animal

duas.meaning: O Allah, I ask You for the goodness within her and the goodness that you have made her inclined towards, and I take refuge with You from the evil within her and the evil that you have made her inclined towards.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni as'aluka khayraha, wa khayra ma jabaltaha  alayhi. Wa a Ã»dhu bika min sharriha wa sharri ma jabaltaha  alayhi.

title: To the newlywed

duas.meaning: May Allah bless for you (your spouse) and bless you, and may He unite both of you in goodness.
duas.transliteration: Baraka llahu laka, wa baraka  alayka, wa jama a baynakuma fi khayrin.

title: When a misbeliever praise Allah after sneezing

duas.meaning: May Allah guide you and rectify your condition.
duas.transliteration: Yahdikumu llahu wa yuslihu balakum.

title: Upon sneezing

duas.meaning:
When one of you sneezes he should say :] All praise if for Allah.
[and his brother or companion should say to him :] May Allah have mercy upon you.
[and the one who sneezed replies back to him :] May Allah guide you and rectify your condition.
duas.transliteration: Al hamdu lillahi. Yarhamuka llahu. Yahdikumu llahu wa yuslihu balakum.

title: Upon seeing the early or premature fruit

duas.meaning: O Allah, bless our fruit for us, bless our town for us, bless our saAA for us and bless our mudd for us.
duas.transliteration: Ammahumma barik lana fi thamarina, wa barik lana fi madinatina, wa barik lana fi sa ina, wa barik lana fi muddina.

title: When insulted while fasting

duas.meaning: I am fasting, I am fasting.
duas.transliteration: Inni saimun ! Inni saimun !

title: By one fasting when presented with food and does not break his fast

duas.meaning: If you are not invited (to a meal) then answer. If you happen to be fasting, then supplicate (for those present) and if you are not fasting, then eat.

title: When breaking fast in someone’s home

duas.meaning: May the fasting break their fast in your home, and may the dutiful and pious eat your food, and may the angles send prayers upon you.
duas.transliteration: Aftara  indakumu ssa'imÃ»na, wa akala ta amakumulabraru, wa sallat  alaykumulmala'ikatu.

title: To one offering a drink or to one who intended to do that

duas.meaning: O Allah, feed him who fed me, and provide with drink him who provided me with drink.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma at im man at amani wa sqi man saqani.

title: Of the guest for the host

duas.meaning: O Allah, bless for them, that which You have provided them, forgive them and have mercy upon them.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma barik lahum fima razaqtahum wa ghfir lahum wa rhamhum.

title: Upon completing the meal

duas.meaning: All praise is for Allah who fed me this and provided it for me without any might nor power from myself.
duas.transliteration: Al hamdu lillahi ladhi at amani hadha wa razaqanihi min ghayrin hawlin minni wa la quwwatin.

duas.meaning: Allah be praised with an abundant beautiful blessed praise, a neverending praise, a praise which we will never bid farewell to and an indispensable praise, He is our Lord.
duas.transliteration: Al hamdu lillahi hamdan kathiran, tayyiban, mubarakan fihi, ghayra makfiyyin wa la muwadda in, wa la mustaghnan  anhu rabbana.

title: Before eating

duas.meaning: In the name of Allah (in it’s beginning and end).
duas.transliteration: Au dÃ©but du repas : Bismi llahi.En cas d'oubli : Bismi llahi fi awwalihi wa akhirihi.

duas.meaning: O Allah, bless it for us and feed us better than it.O Allah, bless it fo it for usand give us more of it.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma barik lana fihi, wa at imna khayran minhu.Allahumma barik lana fihi wa zidna minhu.

title: Upon breaking fast

duas.meaning: The thirst has gone and the veins are quenched, and reward is confirmed, if Allah wills.
duas.transliteration: Dhahaba zzama'u wa btallatil urÃ»qu wa thabatalajru in sha'a llahu.

duas.meaning: O Allah, I ask You by Your mercy which envelopes all things, that You forgive me.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni as'aluka birahmatika llati wasi at kulla shay'in an taghfira li.

title: Upon sighting the crescent moon

duas.meaning: Allah is the greatest. O Allah, let the crescent loom above us in safety, faith, peace, and Islam, and in agreement with all that You love and pleases You. Our Lord and your Lord is Allah.
duas.transliteration: Allahu akbaru. Allahumma ahillahu  alayna bilamni, walimani, wa ssalamati, walislami, wa ttawfiqi lima tuhibbu rabbana wa tarda. Rabbuna wa rabbuka llahu.

title: Asking for clear skies

duas.meaning: O Allah, let the rain fall around us and not upon us, O Allah, (let it fall) on the pastures, hills, valleys and the roots of trees.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma hawalayna wa la  alayna. Allahumma  alalakami wa zzirabi wa butÃ»nilawdiyati wa manabiti shshajari.

title: After rainfall

duas.meaning: We have been given rain by the grace and mercy of Allah.
duas.transliteration: Mutirna bifadli llahi wa rahmatihi.

title: When it rains

duas.meaning: O Allah, may it be a beneficial rain cloud.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma sayyiban nafi an.

title: For rain

duas.meaning: O Allah, send upon us helpful, wholesome and healthy rain, beneficial not harmful rain, now, not later.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma sqina ghaytan mughithan, mari'an, muri an, nafi an ghayra darrin,  ajilan ghayra ajilin.

duas.meaning: O Allah, relieve us, O Allah, relieve us, O Allah, relieve us.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma aghithna ! Allahumma aghithna ! Allahumma aghithna !

duas.meaning: O Allah, provide water for Your servants and Your cattle, spread out Your mercy and resurrect Your dead land.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma sqi  ibadaka wa baha'imaka. Wa bshur rahmataka, wa ahyi baladakalmayyita.

title: Upon hearing thunder

duas.meaning: How perfect He is, (The One) Whom the thunder declares His perfection with His praise, as do the angles out of fear of Him.
duas.transliteration: Subhana lladhi yusabbihu rra du bihamdihi walmala'ikatu min khifatihi.

title: During a wind storm

duas.meaning: O Allah, I ask You for it’s goodness and I take refuge with You from it’s evil.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni as'aluka khayraha wa a Ã»dhu bika min sharriha.

duas.meaning: O Allah, I ask You for it’s goodness, the good within it, and the good it was sent with, and I take refuge with You from it’s evil, the evil within it, and from the evil it was sent with.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni as'aluka khayraha wa khayra ma fiha, wa khayra ma ursilat bihi. Wa a Ã»dhu bika min sharriha, wa sharri ma fiha, wa sharri ma ursilat bihi.

title: Visiting the graves

duas.meaning: Peace be upon you all, O inhabitants of the graves, amongst the believers and the Muslims. Verily we will, Allah willing, be united with you, we ask Allah for wellbeing for us and you.
duas.transliteration: Assalamu  alaykum ahla ddiyari minalmuminina walmuslimina. Wa inna in sha'a llahu bikum lahiqÃ»na [wa yarhamu llahulmustaqdimina minna walmusta'khirina.] As'alu llaha lana wa lakumul afiyata.

title: After burying the deceased

duas.meaning: Seek forgiveness for your brother and pray that he remains firm, for he is now being questioned.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma ghfir lahu, Allahumma thabbithu.

title: Placing the deceased in the grave

duas.meaning: In the name of Allah and upon the sunnah of the Messenger of Allah.
duas.transliteration: Bismi llahi wa  ala sunnati rasÃ»li llahi.

title: Condolence

duas.meaning: Verily to Allah, belongs what He took and to Him belongs what He gave, and everything with Him has an appointed time…and then he r ordered for her to be patient and hope for Allah’s reward.(May Allah magnify your reward, make better your solace and forgive your deceased.)
duas.transliteration: Inna lillahi ma akhadha wa lillahi ma a ta, wa kullu shay'in  indahu biajalin musamman... Faltasbir waltahtasib.A zama llahu ajraka, wa ahsana  aza'ka, wa ghafara limayyitika.

title: When the deceased is a child, during the funeral prayer

duas.meaning: O Lord, protect him from the punishment of the grave (* O Lord, make him a preceding reward and a stored treasure for his parents, and an answered intercessor. O Allah, through him, make heavy their scales and magnify their reward. Unite him with the righteous believers, place him under the care of Ibraheem, and protect him by Your mercy from the torment of Hell. Give him in exchange a better residence and a better family than his. O Allah, forgive our ancestors and our descendants and those who came before us with faith.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma a idhhu min  adhabilqabr.Allahumma j alhu faratan wa dhukran liwalidayhi, wa shafi an mujaban. Allahumma thaqqil bihi mawazinahuma, wa a zim bihi ijÃ»rahuma, wa alhiqhu bisalihilmu'minina. Wa j alhu fi kafalati Ibrahima, wa qihi birahmatika  adhabaljahimi. Wa abdilhu daran khayran min darihi, wa ahlan khayran min ahlihi. Allahumma ghfir liaslafina wa afratina wa man sabaqana biliman

duas.meaning: O Allah, make him a preceding reward, a prepayment and a recompense for us.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma j alhu lana faratan wa salafan wa ajran.

title: For the deceased at the funeral prayer

duas.meaning: O Allah, forgive and have mercy upon him, excuse him and pardon him, and make honourable his reception. Expand his entry, and cleanse him with water, snow, and ice, and purify him of sin as a white robe is purified of filth. Exchange his home for a better home, and his family for a better family, and his spouse for a better spouse. Admit him into the Garden, protect him from the punishment of the grave and the torment of the Fire.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma ghfir lahu wa rhamhu wa  afihi, wa  fu  anhu, wa akrim nuzulahu, wa wassi  mudkhalahu, wa ghsilhu bilma'i wa ththalji walbaradi. Wa naqqihi minalkhataya kama naqqayta ththawbalabyada mina ddanasi. Wa abdilhu daran khayran min darihi, wa ahlan khayran min ahlihi, wa zawjan khayran min zawjihi. Wa dkhilhuljannata wa a idhhu min  adhabilqaqbr [wa  adhabi nnar].

duas.meaning: O Allah, forgive our living and our dead, those present and those absent, our young and our old, our males and our females. O Allah, whom amongst us You keep alive, then let such a life be upon Islam, and whom amongst us You take unto Yourself, then let such a death be upon faith. O Allah, do not deprive us of his reward and do not let us stray after him.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma ghfir lihayyina wa mayyitina, wa shahidina wa gha'ibina, wa saghirina wa kabirina, wa dhakarina wa unthana. Allahumma man ahyaytahu minna faahyihi  alalislami. Wa man tawaffaytahu minna fatawaffahu  alalimani. Allahumma la tahrimna ajrahu wa la tudillaba ba dahu.

duas.meaning: O Allah, soandso is under Your care and protection so protect him from the trial of the grave and torment of the Fire. Indeed You are faithful and truthful. Forgive and have mercy upon him, surely You are The OftForgiving, The MostMerciful.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inna (citer le nom) fi dhimmatika wa habli jiwarika. Faqihi min fitnatilqabri wa  adhabi nnari. Wa anta ahlulwafa'i walhhaqqi. Faghfir lahu wa rhamhu, innaka antalghafÃ»ru rrahim.

duas.meaning: O Allah, Your servant and the son of Your maidservant is in need of Your mercy and You are without need of his punishment. If he was righteous then increase his reward and if he was wicked then look over his sins.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma  abduka wa bnu amatika ihtaja ila rahmatika. Wa anta ghaniyyun  an  adhabihi. In kana muhsinan, fazid fi hasanatihi. Wa in kana musi'an fatajawaz  anhu.

title: When closing the eyes of the deceased

duas.meaning: O Allah, forgive here the name of the deceased is mentioned and raise his rank among the rightly guided, and be a successor to whom he has left behind, and forgive us and him O Lord of the worlds. Make spacious his grave and illuminate it for him.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma ghfir lifulanin (citer son nom) wa rfa  darajatahu filmahdiyyina, wa khlufhu fi  aqibihi filghabirina. Wa ghfir lana wa lahu, ya rabbal alamina, wa fsah lahu fi qabrihi wa nawwir lahu fihi.

title: For one afflicted by a calamity

duas.meaning: To Allah we belong and unto Him is our return.O Allah, recompense me for my affliction and replace it for me with something better.
duas.transliteration: Inna lillahi wa inna ilayhi raji una. Allahumma 'jurni musibati wa khluf li khayran minha.

title: Instruction for the one nearing death

duas.meaning: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah.
duas.transliteration: La ilaha illa llahu

title: When the sick have renounced all hope of life

duas.meaning: O Allah, forgive me, have mercy upon me and unite me with the higher companions.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma ghfir li, wa rhamni, wa alhiqni birrafiqila la.

duas.meaning: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, death does indeed contain agony.
duas.transliteration: La ilaha illa llahu. Inna lilmawti lasakaratin.

duas.meaning: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah and Allah is the greatest.None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone.None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner.None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah and there is no might and no power except with Allah.
duas.transliteration: La ilaha illa llahu wa llahu akbar. La ilaha illa llahu wahdahu. La ilaha illa llahu wahdahu la sharika lahu. La ilaha illa llahu, lahulmulku wa lahulhamdu. La ilaha illa llahu, wa la hawla wa la quwwata illa billahi.

title: Excellence of visiting the sick

duas.meaning: If a man calls on his sick Muslim brother, it is as if he walks reaping the fruits of Paradise until he sits, and when he sits he is showered in mercy, and if this was in the morning, seventy thousand angles send prayers upon him until the evening, and if this was in the evening, seventy thousand angles send prayers upon him until the morning.

title: When visiting the sick

duas.meaning: Never mind, may it (the sickness) be a purification, if Allah wills.
duas.transliteration: La ba'sa, tahÃ»run in sha'a llahu.

duas.meaning: I ask Allah The Supreme, Lord of the magnificent throne to cure you. [seven times
duas.transliteration: As'alu llahal azima, rabbal arshil azimi, an yashfiyaka.

title: Placing childen under Allah’s protection

duas.meaning: I commend you to the protection of Allah’s perfect words from every devil, vermin, and every evil eye.
duas.transliteration: U idhukuma bikalimati llahi ttammati min kulli shaytanin wa hammatin, wa min kulli  aynin lammatin.

title: Congratulation on the occasion of a birth

duas.meaning:
May Allah bless what He allots to you (this child) and may you be grateful to the One who allots him to you. May he (this child) come to maturity and may Allah allot him the good behaviour towards you.

[Answer :] May Allah bless every thing that He allots to you ! May Allah reward you by His forgiveness, allot a newborn like mine to you and give you an abundant retribution.
duas.transliteration: Baraka llahu laka filmawhÃ»bi laka, wa shakartalwahiba, wa balagha ashuddahu, wa ruziqta birrahu.Ce Ã  quoi on rÃ©pond :Baraka llahu laka, wa baraka  alayka, wa jazaka llahu khayran, wa razaqaka llahu mithlahu, wa ajzala thawabaka.

title: When stricken with a mishap or overtaken by an affair

duas.meaning: Allah has decreed and what He wills, He does.
duas.transliteration: Qaddaru llahi wa ma sha'a fa ala.

title: For expelling the devil and his whisperings

duas.meaning: Seek refuge from him.
duas.transliteration: A Ã»dhu billahi mina shshaytani rrajim.

duas.meaning: the athan (call to prayer)
Recitation of the Quran and the authentic texts of remembrance and supplications.

title: Upon committing a sin

duas.meaning: Any servant who commits a sin and as a result, performs ablution, prays two units of prayer and then seeks Allah’s forgiveness, Allah would forgive him.

title: For one whose affairs have become difficult

duas.meaning: O Allah, there is no ease except in that which You have made easy, and You make the difficulty, if You wish, easy.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma la sahla illa ma ja altahu sahlan, wa anta taj alulhazana idha shi'ta sahlan.

duas.meaning: Seek refuge in Allah from him and spit on your left side three times.
duas.transliteration: A Ã»dhu billahi mina shshaytani rrajim.

duas.meaning: O Allah, make what is lawful enough for me, as opposed to what is unlawful, and spare me by Your grace, of need of others.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma kfini bihalalika  an haramika wa ghnini bifadlika  amman siwak.

duas.meaning: O Allah, I take refuge in You from anxiety and sorrow, weakness and laziness, miserliness and cowardice, the burden of debts and from being over powered by men.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a Ã»dhu bika minalhammi walhazani, wal ajzi walkasali, walbukhli waljubni, wa ddala i ddayni wa ghalabati rrijal.

duas.meaning: He should seek refuge in Allah, and renounce that which is causing such doubt.
duas.transliteration: A Ã»dhu billahi mina shshaytani rrajim.

duas.meaning: I have believed in Allah and His Messenger.
duas.transliteration: amantu billahi wa rusÃ»lihi.

duas.meaning: He is The First and The Last, Aththahir and AlBatin and He knows well all things.
duas.transliteration: Huwalawwalu walakhiru wa zzahiru walbatinu, wa huwa bikulli shay'in  alim.

duas.meaning: O Allah, protect me from them with what You choose.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma kfinihim bima shi'ta.

title: Against enemies

duas.meaning: O Allah, Revealer of the Book, Swift at reckoning, defeat the confederates. O Allah, defeat them and convulse them.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma ! Munzilalkitabi, sari alhisabi ! Ihzimilahzaba. Allahumma hzimhum wa zalzilhum.

title: For one afraid of governor's injustice

duas.meaning: O Allah, Lord of the seven heavens and the earth and the great throne, protect me from soandso [tell the name of the person] and from his allies among your creatures, and from being subjected by their abus or tyranny. Honoured is your protected, exalted is your praise, none has the right to be worshipped except You.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma rabba ssamawati ssab i, wa rabbal arshil azimi. Kun li jaran min (citer son nom) wa ahzabihi min khala'iqika, an yafruta  alayya ahadun minhum wa yatgha. Azza jaruka, wa jalla thana'uka, wa la ilaha illa ant.

duas.meaning: Allah is the greatest, Allah is mightier than all things. Allah is mightier than the one I'm afraid of and I mistrust. I take refuge in Allah, none has the right to be worshipped except Allah, who hold back the seven heavens from falling on earth except when he'll allowed this, from the misdeeds of You slave soandso [tell the name of the person], from his soldiers, from his partisans among the djinns and the human beings. Ô Lord ! Be my protector from their misdeeds. Exalted is Your praise, honoured is Your protected, blessed is Your name and none has the right to be worshipped except You.
duas.transliteration: Allahu akbaru. Allahu a azzu min khalqihi jami an. Allahu a azzu mimma akhafu wa ahdharu. A Ã»dhu billahi lladhi la ilaha illa huwalmumsiki ssamawati ssab i an yaqa na  alalardi illa biidhnihi, min sharri  abdika (citer son nom) wa junÃ»dihi wa atba ihi wa ashya ihi minaljinni walinsi. Allahumma kun li jaran min sharrihim. Jalla thana'uka wa  azza aruka, wa tabaraka smuka, wa la ilaha ghayruka.

title: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority

duas.meaning: O Allah, we place You before them and we take refuge in You from their evil.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inna naj aluka fi nuhÃ» rihim, wa na Ã»dhu bika min shurÃ»rihim.

duas.meaning: O Allah, You are my supporter and You are my helper, by You I move and by You I attack and by You I battle.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma anta  adudi, wa anta nasiri. Bika ajÃ»lu, wa bika assÃ»lu, wa bika uqatil.

duas.meaning: Allah is sufficient for us, and how fine a trustee (He is).
duas.transliteration: Hasbuna llahu, wa ni malwakil.

title: For one in distress

duas.meaning: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah Forbearing. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, Lord of the magnificent throne. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, Lord of the heavens, Lord of the Earth and Lord of the noble throne.
duas.transliteration: La ilaha illa llahul azimulhalimu. La ilaha illa llahu, rabbul arshil azim. La ilaha illa llahu, rabbu ssamawati wa rabbulardi wa rabbul arshilkarim.

duas.meaning: O Allah, it is Your mercy that I hope for, so do not leave me in charge of my affairs even for a blink of an eye and rectify for me all of my affairs. None has the right to be worshipped except You.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma rahmataka arjÃ». Fala takilni ila nafsi tarfata  aynin, wa aslih li sha'ni kullahu. La ilaha illa anta.

duas.meaning: None has the right to be worshipped except You. How perfect You are, verily I was among the wrongdoers.
duas.transliteration: La ilaha illa anta, subhanaka, inni kuntu mina zzalimin.

duas.meaning: Allah, Allah is my Lord, I do not associate anything with Him.
duas.transliteration: Allahu, Allahu rabbi. La ushriku bihi shay'an.

title: For anxiety and sorrow

duas.meaning: O Allah, I am Your servant, son of Your servant, son of Your maidservant, my forelock is in Your hand, Your command over me is forever executed and Your decree over me is just. I ask You by every name belonging to You which You named Yourself with, or revealed in Your Book, or You taught to any of Your creation, or You have preserved in the knowledge of the unseen with You, that You make the Quran the life of my heart and the light of my breast, and a departure for my sorrow and a release for my anxiety.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni  abduka, ibnu  abdika, ibnu amatika. Nasiyati biyadika. Madin fiyya hukmuka,  adlun fiyya qada'uka. As'aluka bikulli smin huwa laka, sammayta bihi nafsaka, aw anzaltahu fi kitabika, aw  allamtahu ahadan min khalqika, aw ista'tharta bihi fi  ilmilghaybi  indaka, an taj alalqur'ana rabi a qalbi, wa nÃ»ra ssadri, wa jala'a huzni, wa dhahaba hammi.

duas.meaning: O Allah, I take refuge in You from anxiety and sorrow, weakness and laziness, miserliness and cowardice, the burden of debts and from being over powered by men.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a Ã»dhu bika minalhammi walhazani, wal ajzi walkasali, walbukhli waljubni, wa dala i ddayni wa ghalabati rrijal.

title: Immediately after salam of the witr prayer

duas.meaning: How perfect The King, The Holy One is [three times]. Lord of the angels and the Rooh.
duas.transliteration: SubhanalmalikilquddÃ»si. [Rabbilmala'ikati wa rrÃ»hi.

title: Qunoot AlWitr

duas.meaning: O Allah, guide me along with those whom You have guided, pardon me along with those whom You have pardoned, be an ally to me along with those whom You are an ally to and bless for me that which You have bestowed. Protect me from the evil You have decreed for verily You decree and none can decree over You.For surety, he whom you show allegiance to is never abased and he whom You take as an enemy is never honoured and mighty. O our Lord, Blessed and Exalted are You.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma hdini fiman hadayta wa  afini fiman  afayta, wa tawallani fiman tawallayta, wa barik li fima a tayta, wa qini sharra ma qadayta. Fainnaka taqdi wa la yuqda  alayka. Innahu la yadhillu man walayta [wa la ya izzu man  adayta]. Tabarakata rabbana wa ta alayta.

duas.meaning: O Allah, I take refuge within Your pleasure from Your displeasure and within Your pardon from Your punishment, and I take refuge in You from You. I cannot enumerate Your praise. You are as You have praised Yourself.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a udhu biridaka min sakhattika, wa bimu afatika min  uqÃ»batika. Wa a Ã»dhu bika minka. La uhs thana'an  alayka, anta kama athnayta  ala nafsik.

duas.meaning: O Allah, it is You we worship, and unto You we pray and prostrate, and towards You we hasten and You we serve. We hope for Your mercy and fear Your punishment, verily Your punishment will fall upon the disbelievers.O Allah, we seek Your aid and ask Your pardon, we praise You with all good and do not disbelieve in You.We believe in You and submit unto You, and we disown and reject those who disbelieve in You.
duas.transliteration: Allahumma iyyaka na budu, wa laka nusalli wa nasjudu, wa ilayka nas a wa nahfidu, najrÃ» rahmataka wa nakhsha  adhabaka, inna  adhabaka bilkafirina mulhaqun. Allahumma inna nasta inuka wa nastaghfiruka, wa nuthni  alaykalkhayra wa la nakfuruka, wa nu'minu bika, wa nakhda u laka, wa nakhla u man yakfuruka.

title: Upon seeing a good dream or a bad dream

duas.meaning: Spit on your left three times, seek refuge in Allah from shaytan and the evil of what you saw, do not relate it to anyone, turn and sleep on the opposite side to which you were sleeping on previously.
Get up and pray if you so desire.

title: Upon experiencing unrest, fear, apprehensiveness... during sleep

duas.meaning: I take refuge in the perfect words of Allah from His anger and punishment, and from the evil of His servants, and from the madness and appearance of devils.
duas.transliteration: A Ã»dhu bikalimati llahi ttammati min ghadabihi, wa  iqabihi, wa sharri  ibadihi, wa min hamazati shshayatini, wa an yahdurÃ»ni.

title: When turning over during the night

duas.meaning: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, The One, ALQahhar. Lord of the heavens and the Earth and all between them, The Exalted in Might, The OftForgiving.
duas.transliteration: La ilaha illa llahulwahidulqahharu, rabbu ssamawati walardi wa ma baynahumal azizulghaffar.

title: Before sleeping

duas.meaning: When retiring to his bed every night, the Prophet (saws) would hold his palms together, spit (A form of spitting comprising mainly of air with little spittle) in them, recite the last three chapters (AlIkhlas, AlFalaq, AnNas) of the Quran and then wipe over his entire body as much as possible with his hands, beginning with his head and face and then all parts of the body, he would do this three times.
verse of the footstool : II,255
The last two verses of Surat AlBaqarah

In Your name my Lord, I lie down and in Your name I rise, so if You should take my soul then have mercy upon it, and if You should return my soul then protect it in the manner You do so with Your righteous servants.

O Allah, verily You have created my soul and You shall take it’s life, to You belongs it’s life and death. If You should keep my soul alive then protect it, and if You should take it’s life then forgive it. O Allah, I ask You to grant me good health.
O Allah, protect me from Your punishment on the day Your servants are resurrected. [three times
In Your name O Allah, I live and die.
How Perfect Allah is [thirtythree times]. All praise is for Allah [thirtythree times]. Allah is the greatest. [thirtyfour times

O Allah, Lord of the seven heavens and the exalted throne, our Lord and Lord of all things, Splitter of the seed and the date stone, Revealer of the Tawrah, the Injeel and the Furqan, I take refuge in You from the evil of all things You shall seize by the forelock. O Allah, You are The First so there is nothing before You and You are The Last so there is nothing after You.You are Aththahir so there is nothing above You and You are AlBatin so there is nothing closer than You.Settle our debt for us and spare us from poverty.
All praise is for Allah, Who fed us and gave us drink, and Who is sufficient for us and has sheltered us, for how many have none to suffice them or shelter them.

O Allah, Knower of the seen and the unseen, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Lord and Sovereign of all things I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped except You. I take refuge in You from the evil of my soul and from the evil and shirk of the devil, and from committing wrong against my soul or bringing such upon another Muslim.
Surat AsSajdah : XXXII, Surat AlMulk  : LXVII

O Allah, I submit my soul unto You, and I entrust my affair unto You, and I turn my face towards You, and I totally rely on You, in hope and fear of You. Verily there is no refuge nor safe haven from You except with You. I believe in Your Book which You have revealed and in Your Prophet whom You have sent.

title: In the morning and evening

duas.meaning: the verse of the Footstool (AyatAlKursiy) : surat &#1615;AlBaqarah:255]

duas.meaning: chapters AlIkhlas, AlFalaq and AnNas] (three times after each prayer)

We have reached the evening and at this very time unto Allah belongs all sovereignty, and all praise is for Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent. My Lord, I ask You for the good of this night and the good of what follows it and I take refuge in You from the evil of this night and the evil of what follows it. My Lord, I take refuge in You from laziness and senility. My Lord, I take refuge in You from torment in the Fire and punishment in the grave.

In the morning :] O Allah, by your leave we have reached the morning and by Your leave we have reached the evening, by Your leave we live and die and unto You is our resurrection. / [In the evening :] O Allah, by Your leave we have reached the evening and by Your leave we have reached the morning, by Your leave we live and die and unto You is our return.

O Allah, You are my Lord, none has the right to be worshipped except You, You created me and I am Your servant and I abide to Your covenant and promise as best I can, I take refuge in You from the evil of which I have committed. I acknowledge Your favour upon me and I acknowledge my sin, so forgive me, for verily none can forgive sin except You.

Allahumma anta rabbi, la ilaha illa anta.

[Four times in the morning and evening
O Allah, what blessing I or any of Your creation have risen upon, is from You alone, without partner, so for You is all praise and unto You all thanks.

O Allah, I take refuge with You from disbelief and poverty, and I take refuge with You from the punishment of the grave ; none has the right to be worshipped except You [Three times].

duas.transliteration: Hasbiya llahu la ilaha illa huwa  alayhi tawakkaltu, wa huwa rabbul arshil azimi. (7x)

duas.meaning: O Allah, I ask You for pardon and wellbeing in this life and the next. O Allah, I ask You for pardon and wellbeing in my religious and worldly affairs, and my family and my wealth. O Allah, veil my weaknesses and set at ease my dismay. O Allah, preserve me from the front and from behind and on my right and on my left and from above, and I take refuge with You lest I be swallowed up by the earth.

O Allah, Knower of the unseen and the seen, Creator of the heavens and the Earth, Lord and Sovereign of all things, I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped except You. I take refuge in You from the evil of my soul and from the evil and shirk of the devil, and from committing wrong against my soul or bringing such upon another Muslim.
In the name of Allah with whose name nothing is harmed on earth nor in the heavens and He is The AllSeeing, The AllKnowing. [Three times

O Ever Living, O SelfSubsisting and Supporter of all, by Your mercy I seek assistance, rectify for me all of my affairs and do not leave me to myself, even for the blink of an eye.

In the morning :] We have reached the morning and at this very time all sovereignty belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds. O Allah, I ask You for the good of this day, its triumphs and its victories, its light and its blessings and its guidance, and I take refuge in You from the evil of this day and the evil that follows it. / [In the envening :] We have reached the evening and at this very time all sovereignty belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds. O Allah, I ask You for the good of tonight, its triumphs and its victories, its light and its blessings and its guidance, and I take refuge in You from the evil of tonight and the evil that follows it.

We rise upon the fitrah of Islam, and the word of pure faith, and upon the religion of our Prophet Muhammad (saws) and the religion of our forefather Ibraheem, who was a Muslim and of true faith and was not of those who associate others with Allah.

I seek Your forgiveness, Allah, and repent unto You.’
I take refuge in Allah’s perfect words from the evil He has created. [Three times in the evening
O Allah, send prayers and blessings upon our prophet Muhammad. (ten times)

title: For seeking guidance in forming a decision or choosing the proper course

duas.meaning: O Allah, I seek Your counsel by Your knowledge and by Your power I seek strength and I ask You from Your immense favour, for verily You are able while I am not and verily You know while I do not and You are the Knower of the unseen. O Allah, if You know this affair and here he mentions his need to be good for me in relation to my religion, my life, and end, then decree and facilitate it for me, and bless me with it, and if You know this affair to be ill for me towards my religion, my life, and end, then remove it from me and remove me from it, and decree for me what is good wherever it be and make me satisfied with such.

duas.meaning: I have turned my face sincerely towards He who has brought forth the heavens and the Earth and I am not of those who associate (others with Allah). You are my Lord and I am Your servant, I have wronged my own soul and have acknowledged my sin, so forgive me all my sins for no one forgives sins except You. Guide me to the best of characters for none can guide to it other than You, and deliver me from the worst of characters for none can deliver me from it other than You. Here I am, in answer to Your call, happy to serve you. All good is within Your hands and evil does not stem from You. I exist by your will and will return to you. Blessed and High are You, I seek Your forgiveness and repent unto You.

Faghfir li dhunÃ»bi jami an, innahu la yaghfiru dhdhunÃ»ba illa anta. Wa hdini liahsanilakhlaqi, la yahdi liahsaniha illa anta. Wa srif  anni sayyi'aha, la yasrifu  anni sayy'aha illa anta. Labbayka wa sa dayka, walkhayru kulluhu biyadayka, wa shsharru laysa ilayka, ana bika wa ilayka, tabarakta wa ta alayta, astaghfiruka wa atÃ»bu ilayka.

duas.meaning: O Allah, Lord of Jibraeel, Meekaeel and Israfeel (great angles), Creator of the heavens and the Earth, Knower of the seen and the unseen. You are the arbitrator between Your servants in that which they have disputed. duas.meaning: Allah is Most Great, Allah is Most Great, Allah is Most Great, much praise is for Allah, much praise is for Allah, much praise is for Allah, and I declare the perfection of Allah in the early morning and in the late afternoon [three times]. duas.meaning: O Allah, to You belongs all praise, You are the Light of the heavens and the Earth and all that is within them. To You belongs all praise, You are the King of the heavens and the Earth and to You belongs all praise. So forgive me for what has come to pass of my sins and what will come to pass, and what I have hidden and what I have made public. You are AlMuqaddim and AlMuakhkhir. None has the right to be worshipped except You, You are my Deity, none has the right to be worshipped except You.

duas.meaning: One repeats just as the muathin (one who calls to prayer) says, except when he says : ‘come to prayer, come to success’. Instead, one should say : ‘There is no might nor power except with Allah.’].
